body: Every week a Guardian Money reader submits a question, and it’s up to you to help him or her out – a selection of the best answers will appear in next Saturday’s paper. This week’s question:  My daughter, 18, is about to leave school and wants to buy her form tutor a present. This teacher really helped her over many years and a bottle of wine doesn’t seem enough. What, if anything, would be appropriate – what do teachers like to receive? Do you have a problem readers could solve? Email your suggestions to money@theguardian.com or write to us at Money, The Guardian, Kings Place, 90 York Way, London N1 9GU.
webTitle: What can my daughter buy her form tutor as a leaving gift?
